AuditorResults.Description: CRITICAL SLO BREACH: Availability SLO for PetClinic service is severely breached. Target: 99.0%, Actual: 87.5% (11.5% below target). This indicates a major availability issue affecting user requests.

HIGH ERROR RATE DETECTED: POST /appointments operation showing 12.5% error rate (baseline: 0.2%). Average latency increased from 200ms to 2.5s. Errors primarily occur during appointment booking operations.

TRACE ANALYSIS - ROOT CAUSE IDENTIFIED:

Analyzed 450 failed traces for POST /appointments operation. Common exception pattern found:

Exception Type: software.amazon.awssdk.services.dynamodb.model.ProvisionedThroughputExceededException
Exception Message: "The level of configured provisioned throughput for the table was exceeded. Consider increasing your provisioning level with the UpdateTable API. (Service: DynamoDb, Status Code: 400, Request ID: 6HOGQ...)"

Call Stack:
1. PetClinic Service - POST /appointments (2500ms, ERROR)
2. SchedulingService - createAppointment() (2400ms, ERROR)
3. DynamoDB - PutItem on appointments table (2300ms, THROTTLED)

Analysis: 95% of failed requests show DynamoDB throttling. The appointments table is configured with 5 WCU (Write Capacity Units) but is receiving ~450 write requests during peak hours, causing systematic throttling.

Recommendation: Increase DynamoDB table capacity or enable auto-scaling.

DEPENDENCY ISSUE: DynamoDB dependency shows high throttling rate. 95% of requests to appointments table are being throttled. This is blocking the scheduling service from completing appointment bookings.
